name: Hotel Palomar Dallas - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a weekend at the Palomar in September. It is a beautifully decorated small hotel. Our room was comfortable. We had some minor gripes: We didn't like the pillows and there was no disposable shower cap. The pool area is pretty. The staff was really nice. The food at the hotel's restaurant was very good. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner there. I also had a 60-minute massage at the hotel's spa "Exhale Spa" and it was fabulous. Please know that there's only valet parking at this hotel and it costs $20/night. We'd recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for our honeymoon. Some thought we were crazy to go to Dallas and stay at a hotel other than "the W" but they were eating their words later. There are two guys who stand out as far as making our experience better. One of the drivers who took us around several times became like our friend for the week, very friendly and nice. The first impression of the hotel however was a guy (Mike?) who helped us get our bags, took us to our room, and made us feel at ease (since hotels.com screwed up our reservation completely, thanks guys). We got an incredible deal through hotels.com BUT next time I'd probably just keep an eye on the Palomar's website because they offered something like 30% off of room rates for an advanced booking.
reviews.title: Honeymooners Delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was wonderful. Very nice bed, linens on the bed, couch, tv, etc. My wife forgot a curling iron and they were able to provide her with one. I was able to charge my iphone daily with the provided iHome dock. The wifi was free because we signed up with a free service with Kimpton hotels. They delivered strawberries and champagne for free with a note welcoming us to the hotel for our honeymoon. They were able to recommend incredible restaurants and things to do as well as drive us to many of them (within 3 miles of the hotel, for free). The pool was incredible (we spent a lot of time there): An infinity edge pool, free water, restaurant service available, private cabanas with comfy bed/couches, hot tub, great music, and giant towels. Also, daily they had a wine tasting in the lobby and one day they even had an ice cream bar! My wife and I were very blessed to have found such a great deal for our honeymoon. We've been thinking of excuses to go back because if you stay in a Kimpton hotel 10 nights in a year (I believe it was 10) then you get 2 nights free when you sign-up for the free service (that gets you the free wifi as already mentioned).
reviews.title: Better Than The Best

reviews.text: Complaints, there had to be some! Overnight parking: unfortunately $10/night, but necessary. The restaurant in the hotel was insanely priced. It was our honeymoon and we could have splurged on the restaurant, but instead went shopping and bought more stuff. If you have the money, it looked very very nice, but I'm enjoying the coat I bought instead! The same goes for room service. PB&J shouldn't be $15. Lastly, the spa attached to the hotel leads you to believe you will receive a free massage session just for staying at the hotel when in the fine print it says you'll receive a free one with the purchase of like a 2 hour massage. Instead we went to a massage place a few miles down the road and got an hour long couples massage for less than one hour for a single at the hotel.
reviews.title: One of the top hotels in Dallas...unique, modern, comfortable

reviews.text: Modern customer service expectations are so low that to experience the warmth and support of the staff I felt this past weekend at Hotel Palomar initially felt surreal. This was my experience being greeted by the friendly valet-men and the professional bell-hops. My introduction to Hotel Palomar inspired memories of a time when people treated other people like family, folks had pride in their job, and going the extra mile was "no trouble at all". By the time I made it through the front doors of the hotel, I had a smile on my face, I was relaxed, and I realized that this hotel was special.
reviews.title: Totally Fab

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar since reviews of all the other major hotel chains in the Dallas/Richardson area were very poor. This hotel has a very interesting decor, very modern with pools, fountains and unusual furnishings. It also has a high end spa, fitness center, and outdoor infinity swimming pool. The rooms are very modern, well furnished, with top of the line bedding and pillows. The air conditioning system works extremely well.
reviews.title: Upscale avant guard different

reviews.text: Staff is friendly with the one exception of the concierge being on the snippy side as well as not being informed regarding local restaurants. Cars must be valeted with an overnight charge of $20 per night.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located at the intersection of Mockingbird East and I75 however at a confusing and difficult intersection. It took some getting used to while trying to enter and exit.
reviews.title: Hotel Palomar - The Best in Texas!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is very good but expensive. A bar dish of 2 crabcakes cost $22 with tip and I had to find another restaurant afterwards as I was still hungry. There are other good restaurants located directly across the street in a small shopping center.
reviews.title: SIMPLY AMAZING!

reviews.text: All in all an excellent hotel and I would definitely stay here again on my next trip.
reviews.title: We stayed July 22-23 for sweetie's...
Provided delicious gluten-free/dairy-free food
reviews.text: I went to the Palomar for a business meeting in one of the conference rooms. Lunch was provided by the hotel, but I can't eat gluten and dairy. My HR director let the hotel know about my food allergies, and they prepared a special meal for me. It was delicious and, most importantly, was very similar to what everyone else was eating. They even made some snickerdoodle cookies for me, which is unique because most restaurants won't even try to make me a dessert (since I can't eat wheat flour). I felt very happy and very full with my special meal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled to Dallas over the 4 July holiday for a birthday getaway with my partner and extended family. Familiar with and a fan of the Kimpton brand, I decided to stay at the Palomar, and couldn't be more pleased with the experience. My partner and I booked a suite, which was spacious and comfortable - if not a bit sparse in the living room area. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom - with separate shower and jacuzzi soaking tub - was excellent.
reviews.title: Exquisite stay; wonderful hospitality, welcome, service, and attention

reviews.text: More than the room and overall decor/feel of the hotel, I was most impressed with and pleased by the welcome and attention from the staff. I have to especially commend the concierge, Eloy Calvo. He helped my partner make various arrangements for my birthday, and ensured we had a superb experience at Charlie Palmer (at another Dallas hotel) for dinner. Always pleasant and smiling, he really embodied a spirit of hospitality. Other members of the reception staff and valet service were also incredibly helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend Exhale, the attached spa, where my partner and I spent a relaxing saturday afternoon of pampering. Only ate breakfast at Central 214, and while pleasant, I was somewhat disappointed with the biscuits and gravy I ordered one morning. The french toast was good, and the fruit plate was well presented with a nice variety.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel

reviews.text: Definitely recommend the hotel for a visit to the Big D.
reviews.title: Hotel Palomar Dallas exceeded all expectations!

reviews.text: Hotel Palomar is simply beautiful and perfectly located for any activities in Dallas. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and their restaurant, Central 214, was amazing both in food and atmosphere. Enjoyed the pool, complete with pool side dining! Also visited the spa and relaxed in style. Everything about our stay was wonderful and totally relaxing. The staff went out of their way to make sure everything was always to our liking. The manager's wine reception each evening was very nice in their beautiful lobby area. I highly recommend both the hotel and restaurant.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: I heard about this Hotel from a friend. She told me I should take my dog because it is dog friendly. Well, I did. And this hotel is awesome! It is beautiful, has a wine social in the lobby, lovely pool area, and my dog Holly ( a 43 lb husky) was treated like a VIP! They even allowed me to stay in one of the suites with her. She had a bed, bowls, bottle water and treats waiting for her in the room. Thank you Palomar, for making us feel so welcomed! I will spread the word about your hotel.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a trip thru Dallas, and stayed for the first time at the Hotel Palomar and must say that it was the HIGHLIGHT of our trip!!!
reviews.title: Hotel Palomar how do I love thee, let me count the ways...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we did not have our puppy with us, we plan on returning and bringing her along next time. In the meantime, we can now bring her to dinner with us at the local Kimpton property here in Scottsdale, Arizona. Coincidentally, we recently attended a wedding at the FireSky Resort in Scottsdale and never realized this was the very same chain of Kimpton properties.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So back to our love affair with the Palomar, here are just a few of the many reasons why we loved staying here:
reviews.title: Chic Interior in central (but dull) location with easy highway access

description: Hotel Palomar Dallas is a luxury boutique hotel centrally located in the upscale Park Cities neighborhood near downtown Dallas. Distinctly Dallas, this sophisticated sanctuary adjacent to Central 214 restaurant, puts you near the city’s best shopping and dining and minutes from destinations like Southern Methodist University, North Park Centre and the American Airlines Center. This beautifully appointed Kimpton Hotel stylishly evokes the expansive Texas landscape while cradling you in comfort.
